p: The present work provides an overview about the state-of-the-art in ethnobotany, phytochemistry, and a detailed analysis of the pharmacological properties of T. occidentalis, such us: antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, antibacterial, antifungal, anticancer, antiviral, protective activity of the gastrointestinal tract, radioprotection, antipyretic, and lipid metabolism regulatory activity, in order to promote all the biological activities shown so far, rather than the antitumor activity that has promoted it as a medicinal species.
